job_title: Librarian in Orlando, FL
pros: Good for students Easy decent pay
cons: Kind of boring Not very engaging

job_title: Clinician 2 in Norwich, CT
pros: Flexible schedules, free ceu, sick time
cons: High case load, mandatory groups

job_title: Mental Health Clinician in Norwich, CT
pros: Supervision opportunities and trainings readily available
cons: Horrible work environment and not a fair wage for what they expect in productivity

review_title: Great place to start your career!
job_title: Supervisor in Norwich, CT
pros: I have learned almost everything I know as a successful supervisor (previously clinician) from my training and experience here. The programs within the behavioral health department have high standards for practice and ethics. UCFS overall works closely together to meet the needs of the community-members served. There is a lot of benefit to being in a non-profit including loan reimbursement, clinical supervision, in-house training, and more. There is room to grow and move up within the agency.
cons: I don't have any cons I can think of at this time.

job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Norwich, CT
pros: Great Co-workers, good communication between intake and therapists. Enjoyed the programs and ability to create your own.
cons: Too many managers, micromanaging, and poor pay.

job_title: Medical Billing Specialist in Hartford, CT
pros: Remote, work from home. Kind supervisors. Lots of errors=lots of learning opportunities
cons: Low pay, not commensurate with education or experience. Lots of red tape and cutting of corners so that they can hire less qualified people for less pay. No advancement opportunities.

job_title: Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner in Norwich, CT
pros: Great people work here but are isolated from each other.
cons: They are losing people left and right because they are not keeping up with salaries and are engaged in useless dilly dallying with various studies and surveys.

job_title: Mental Health Clinician in Norwich, CT
pros: The structure of the agency allows for clinical support for new clincians. Opportunity to work remotely/ hybrid
cons: Raises are minimal, not much opportunity for growth. In any large agency you are dispensable.

job_title: Administrative Coordinator in Norwich, CT
pros: 401k contribution after a year of employment. Flexible with time off.
cons: Senior Management has ruined the possibility of UCFS being functional and productive. They drove out every good person who works for the company and don’t see an issue. They force you to take on much more than you’re responsible for and don’t pay accordingly. They treat good workers badly and reward bad workers. They work for the community but treat them badly. Extreme high turnover leads to bad client care.

job_title: Family Based Recovery Clinician II in Norwich, CT
pros: Flexibility, training, 401K great! Coworkers awesome!
cons: Supervision critical, unaware of their negative impact on staff and team unity.

job_title: School Based Therapist in Norwich, CT
pros: Friendly work environment within the schools, school hrs and schedule.
cons: Low salary and found Human Resources be to unhelpful.

job_title: Mental Health Clinician in Norwich, CT
pros:
Friendly, supportive, fun work environment
Autonomy
Working with children/adolescents
Work from home
Excellent, thorough, ongoing training
Excellent support through frequent supervision
Evidence based treatments that have excellent results for clients
Diverse workplace (race, ethnicity, languages, gender, sexual orientation, etc.)
Available management (even the CEO is around and makes sure to visit each site monthly)
Many events to recognize employees, picnics, etc.
Lots of charity work done by employees
Lots of promotions from within-large enough company to have room to grow
Company is growing and expanding it's locations and services to meet local needs
cons: Not as much paid time off as other similar agencies

job_title: Supervisor of Emergency Mobile Psychiatric Services (EMPS) in Danielson, CT
pros: UCFS is a large agency with room for growth and movement among the agency.  The agency provides many benefits and tries to consider the family needs of the individual.  Agency has a culture that seems to care about the client but struggles to maintain that with continued insruance and state budget restrictions.
cons: The opinion of one person can go a long way in tarnishing the reputation of an employee.  If a manager is attached to a program that is doing well, that persons behaviors can be overlooked creating a hostile and unsupportive environment of employees

review_title: Wish I had found UCFS sooner!
job_title: in Norwich, CT
pros: I joined UCFS after being employed in the “for profit” workplace. I am truly amazed at the difference in the two environments.  UCFS has a participative culture and embraces the philosophy that the workplace can be productive and fun at the same time. The agency is always changing to serve the challenges of the community.
cons: I don't have any CONS. I would say change that is constant, but is necessary for any thriving company.

review_title: Truly value the employee as much as the patient.
job_title: Medical Assistant in Griswold, CT
pros: I have worked alot of different places in health care. From urgent care to speciality. And when I say this company has shown me more compassion, understanding, and empathy in 1 short year. I can see myself retiring from here. Who says that now a days? The pay isn't horrible. But it's not amazing. But literally everything else is. The training. The fact you are meant to feel part of a family and something bigger than yourself. When all your coworkers and providers have the same end goal. Amazing patient care. And watching it all get coordinated is one of the most satisfying experiences. Comprehensive care. And I am so impressed with the way they handled covid. Constant communication, relevant information and facts. And they took our health and safety as a priority more if not equal to the patients. They only returned us to work once it was safe. And the benefits are really good too. I can't speak to benefits for everyone. But mine personally aren't too much and worth every penny. I also like how when I'm too sick to come to work. I'm told to feel better and that's it. Which if you know is unheard of. But supervisors from within the clinic throughout upper management are all so transparent, genuine, kind, helpful people and really only want the best for you. It's truly an amazing place to work and what I imagine work was for most people become it all became so impersonal and industrialized. It feels like a small company. But its so big and does so much. I very rarely have overtime, but have the opportunity to do so if I want.
cons: Long hours. But no longer than any other job. And the day always goes by so fast.

review_title: Great Experience for New Social Workers
job_title: Licensed Clinical Social Worker in Norwich, CT
pros: Interesting cases, multiple adolescent treatment models, training, decent pay
cons: Overworked and under supported, caseloads just keep increasing, told everyone has to work more than 40 hours to get their work done in order to "put in your dues"

job_title: School Social Worker in Norwich, CT
pros: Good points include autonomy, senior management can be reached without excessive effort
cons: Supervised by someone who did not know my job and did not learn about what my day to day tasks were like. I was consistently told that supervisors had other tasks and had little time for me. Lots of office politics that grew out of personality conflicts.  Compensation is very low- about 60% of what was paid in other agencies.

job_title: Client Account Representative in Norwich, CT
pros: Good fringe benefits and employer sponsored events.
cons: Too many supervisors/management and not enough support staff. Pay is low, work loads are always growing and very little response to feedback from upper management

job_title: in Norwich, CT
pros: Supervisor was great and supportive.  CEO always addressed me by name and I saw him on very few occasions and with so many employees that is no small task.
cons: dont have any to list.

job_title: FBR Clinician in Norwich, CT
pros: While at UCFS, I have had the pleasure of working alongside many great co-workers.
cons: At times supervisors have been difficult.

job_title: Speakers Bureau in Charlotte, NC
pros: Great mission, good work, great causes
cons: Low pay, little room for advancement depending on team lead
